title: (x) Syfy Website typeface - Syfy Sans (custom, based on Crank 8) - Stephen L
content:
I'd assume this is made especially for Syfy, but it doesn't hurt to ask the masters.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013165545im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4002.png)
author: neuroman

comments.content:
Hi Ivan,

You'd be right. That's Syfy Sans, a reworked version of Crank 8. See here: [http://typophile.com/node/63741](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013165545/http:/typophile.com/node/63741 "http://typophile.com/node/63741")

By the way, I know Typophile search isn't working, but you can search for previous IDs from Google by entering, for example, "site:typophile.com syfy". That's how I found the above link. Friendly tip. :)

Amazing. I would have just taken a look at that, and assumed it was, say, Neo Sans:

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/neo-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013165545/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/neo-sans/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/neo-sans/")

or DIN Schriften

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/din-schriften/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013165545/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/din-schriften/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/din-schriften/")

and not given it a second thought.
Stephen, thank you very much. I've searched "syfy" on typophile forums, but I was naive and ignorant enough not to know that Typophile search is not working. I will do in the future.
No worries. I'm sure it'll be back working soon, but in the meantime that Google trick is a nice little work-around.
